adjectives.description: backstairs (comparative more backstairs, superlative most backstairs)

examples: […]  if some peers (I am very sorry they are not as many as they ought to be) set themselves, in the great concern of peers and commons, against a back-stairs influence and clandestine government, then the alarm begins; then the constitution is in danger of being forced into an aristocracy.

entries.meaning: A staircase at the rear of a building or one normally only used by servants and tradesmen.
examples: Other feet were already in the lower flight of the backstairs; but the upper flight was the one for me, and in an instant we were racing along the upper corridor  […]

entries.meaning: An indirect or furtive means of access or intercourse.
